The post Belle Isle Bayou appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
The Belle Isle Bayou is a new cajun restaurant at the corner of Conway and Hoffner and it is delicious. All of the food seems fresh and slightly different takes on bayou favorites.

Pictured at top is the jambalaya pasta. It’s your typical jambalaya with sausage, chicken, peppers, etc, but instead of being mixed with brown rice, it’s mixed with penne pasta and a white cream sauce. It’s killer.

Also pictured are shrimp and grits, which are cheesy and wonderful; fried pickles which are thick cut, crispy, and great; and a different take on a caesar salad that includes tomatoes and lettuce that has sat for just a second on the wood grill to produce sear marks and a nice smokey flavor.

If you’re looking for a new place to try, and you’re in the mood for some fresh cajun fare, give Belle Isle Bayou a try. You’ll be glad you did.

The post Belle Isle Bayou appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
